communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All Real Time Crime Center footage recorded by the St Louis Police Department taken on January 26, 2024 between the times of 3:35pm and 4:05pm between and including the intersections of Arsenal and Kingshighway and Bircher and Kingshighway. Please provide footage for all cameras along Kingshighway between and including the two listed intersections during the timeframe listed. 

I request that in conducting searches for releasable records, that you please disclose records even if they are currently available publicly through your agency portal other sources outside of your agency.

As the records sought detail the activities of citizens throughout the St Louis community governed by the City of St Louis and protected by St Louis Metropolitan Police Department, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: OEMS Investigations and Sanctions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The reports, sanctions, and associated documents related to ALL OEMS investigations that resulted in a resolution plan that includes a referral of the matter to the office of general counsel, agency action, issuance of cease and desist, settlement agreement, surrender of license, in calendar years 2022, 2023, and 2024 to date. 

This request includes all types of complaints, serious incidents and investigations, even if agency actions not (yet) issued. If general counsel has issued sanctions, please provide copies of all agency actions or associated documentation. Please include any cases pending agency action or appeal.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Glenn Stone

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Texts - JL
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All of Jason Lee's text messages from February 6, 2024 - February 13, 2024.

Please note: This seeks texts Jason Lee sent and any group chat texts including Jason Lee related to city business. This also includes any messages sent through WhatsApp, Signal, or any other text messaging apps. If any app is used with a disappearing messages setting, please provide the setting on disappearing messages. Please search city and personal phones.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Taliaferro
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any emails to and from Chris Taliaferro with the words "shot spotter" "shotspotter" or "crime tracer" "crimetracer" or "sound thinking" "soundthinking", from December 1, 2023 to the date this request is processed.

Please search all of Taliaferro's city email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. Please include any attachments and remove any duplicates. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin
